name: AnchorWatch

faqs.q: How does AnchorWatch's Trident vault insurance work?
faqs.a: AnchorWatch locks each deposit inside a Trident 2-of-3 multisig vault that maps to a Lloyd's-backed policy, so coverage follows the exact UTXO you fund. If you permanently lose control under the policy terms, you can file a claim instead of eating the loss.

faqs.q: What does AnchorWatch charge for custody insurance?
faqs.a: Premiums run roughly 0.55%–2% of the insured value per year and are paid up front in USD. A Trident Services Fee of up to 0.25% annually (first $250k waived) is billed monthly so you can size coverage to your treasury.

faqs.q: How fast can I move bitcoin out of an AnchorWatch vault?
faqs.a: You prepare and sign the spend in Trident, submit your evidence package, and AnchorWatch usually clears compliance plus its signature within one to two business days. Plan larger withdrawals ahead so insurance controls never become a surprise bottleneck.

faqs.q: Does AnchorWatch require KYC and where is it available?
faqs.a: Yes. AnchorWatch underwrites regulated US policies, so onboarding requires identity documents or KYB packages and they currently insure only US-based clients.

faqs.q: How are customer keys and funds segregated at AnchorWatch?
faqs.a: You generate your own keys on factory-sealed devices, and each vault has a unique output descriptor that proves funds are never commingled with other policyholders. You can verify segregation on-chain before depositing sats.

recovery_method: Time-locked multisig recovery
description:
AnchorWatch is a U.S.-based bitcoin custody and insurance provider trying to bridge traditional insurance with Bitcoin-native custody, delivering peace of mind by offering an elegant, turnkey solution for long-term bitcoin holders and corporate treasuries seeking secure, insured, and inheritance-ready custody.

What separates AnchorWatch is their unique integration of protocol-level multisig vaults with time-locked recovery and insurance. Users hold a multi-signature key set alongside AnchorWatch; both are required to sign transactions, and over time additional recovery mechanisms activate to handle key-loss, death, or coercion scenarios.

User reviews and discussions (e.g. from the Build With Bitcoin transcript) emphasize AnchorWatch's layered approach: the combination of vault tech and insurance addresses both technical and human vulnerabilities. The service also supports inheritance planning—time-locked access for heirs without cumbersome "treasure maps". This focus on estate continuity is cited as a major differentiator, especially for non-technical beneficiaries.

Their future vision includes expanding beyond U.S. customers, offering bespoke large-value enterprise policies, and exploring Bitcoin-denominated insurance.

tl_dr.best_for: AnchorWatch pairs Trident multisig vaults with Lloyd's-backed insurance so US treasuries and families can keep keys cold without giving up coverage. Choose it when you want estate, audit, and compliance workflows around long-term bitcoin.
tl_dr.consider_if: The service adds a compliance desk to every spend, which means you must plan withdrawals ahead of time. Consider it if you want that oversight plus access to insurance-grade recovery tooling.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: Because AnchorWatch must sign each spend, you trade speed for assurance. It's not ideal when you need instant, global, or anonymous control.

steps.title: 1. Choose policy & secure keys
actions: Meet AnchorWatch underwriting, review coverage tiers, and set the USD limit you want insured.
Complete KYC or KYB, sign the engagement letter, and receive the factory-sealed signing devices they ship.
Generate your customer keys during the onboarding call so AnchorWatch never sees the seed material.
steps.gotcha: Insurance underwriting requires US residency or entity registration plus identity verification.

steps.title: 2. Build and test the vault
actions: Configure the Trident miniscript policy, label each signer, and review the vault's output descriptor together.
Send a small test deposit, confirm it on your own node, and log the insured UTXO ID provided in the policy.
Document the recovery script and store redundant copies offline for board reviews.
steps.gotcha: Skipping the descriptor review means you cannot independently prove the vault's policy later.

steps.title: 3. Operationalize compliance & inheritance
actions: Define compliance contacts so AnchorWatch knows who can request co-signatures and who gets alerts.
Set withdrawal workflows, including evidence AnchorWatch needs before it signs and the one-to-two business day window.
Add beneficiaries or board-approved heirs in Trident so inheritance and insurance claims share paperwork.
steps.gotcha: Transactions requested outside the documented workflow are delayed until compliance can verify them.

micro_faqs.q: Do I have to use Trident to be insured by AnchorWatch?
micro_faqs.a: Yes. The insurance is bound to Trident's miniscript vault so AnchorWatch can verify keys and sign when policy terms are met.

micro_faqs.q: How fast does AnchorWatch co-sign transactions?
micro_faqs.a: After you sign and submit supporting evidence, AnchorWatch usually completes compliance checks and adds its signature within one to two business days.

micro_faqs.q: What if every customer key is lost?
micro_faqs.a: AnchorWatch can invoke the time-locked recovery path with its emergency partner, or you can file a claim that covers the permanent loss if policy conditions are met.

name: Aqua

faqs.q: What networks does Aqua support?
faqs.a: Aqua keeps one balance spanning Bitcoin on-chain, the Liquid sidechain, and Lightning. You can also swap USDt to other chains through partners when needed.

faqs.q: Does Aqua require KYC?
faqs.a: No. The wallet is self-custodial. You only share an email if you opt into JAN3 services such as the Dolphin Card.

faqs.q: How do Lightning payments work in Aqua?
faqs.a: Aqua sends and receives Lightning through Boltz submarine swaps. You pay in L-BTC, Boltz settles over Lightning, and any refunds return to your Liquid balance.

faqs.q: Can I import an existing seed phrase into Aqua?
faqs.a: Aqua only restores wallets that were originally created inside the app. It generates a 12-word seed that you should store offline as your only backup.

faqs.q: How does Aqua handle USDt on other blockchains?
faqs.a: USDt on Liquid is native. When you send or receive USDt on networks like Ethereum or Tron, Aqua routes the transaction through swap providers such as SideShift or Changelly and their fees apply.

description:
Aqua is JAN3's mobile wallet that keeps Bitcoin, Liquid, and Lightning funds in one place. The app is self-custodial, so you write down a 12-word seed and control every transaction.

Aqua leans on Liquid for privacy and low fees, while Boltz swaps unlock Lightning spending without running your own channels. You can peg-in on-chain BTC, hold USDt on Liquid, and bridge to other networks when required.

Optional extras such as the Dolphin Card and future marketplace services build on the same wallet, so newcomers can start with simple payments and grow into more advanced features as they get comfortable.

tl_dr.best_for: Mobile Bitcoiners who want Liquid privacy and the option to spend over Lightning without running channels.
tl_dr.consider_if: You plan to hold USDt on Liquid or need the Dolphin Card for day-to-day expenses.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You need rock-bottom Lightning fees or rely on desktop wallets.

name: Bisq

faqs.q: How do Bisq trading fees and BSQ discounts work?
faqs.a: Bisq sets maker fees at 0.15% and taker fees at 1.15% when you pay in BTC, and the DAO halves each rate to 0.075% and 0.575% if you spend BSQ. You can choose the fee currency before confirming a trade and see the exact total on the review screen.

faqs.q: What security deposit do Bisq trades require?
faqs.a: Every trade locks both parties' refundable security deposits in a 2-of-2 multisig escrow alongside the trade amount. Deposit sizes vary by payment method and account signing stage, and Bisq shows the required amount before you accept an offer.

faqs.q: Which payment methods can I use on Bisq worldwide?
faqs.a: Bisq supports rails such as SEPA, Zelle, Wise, Revolut, and cash trades, each with its own settlement window and trade limit. You can filter the offer book by payment method to find rails that match your country.

faqs.q: Does Bisq require identity verification or accounts?
faqs.a: Bisq runs over Tor with no central accounts or KYC, so your payment profiles and trade history stay on your computer. You share the needed details only with your counterparty during the trade.

faqs.q: How long do Bisq trades take to settle?
faqs.a: A Bisq trade waits for the escrow transaction to confirm on-chain, then gives you a payment window that ranges from minutes on crypto rails to four to six days on fiat rails. Once both sides mark payment sent and received, the escrow releases and your deposit returns automatically.

description:
Bisq is a decentralized, open‑source desktop app created by Manfred Karrer for buying and selling bitcoin directly with other people. It routes all traffic over Tor, uses a built‑in non‑custodial wallet and has no sign‑ups or KYC. Trades span many national currencies and payment rails, and the project is funded and governed through a community DAO with the BSQ token rather than a company.

What separates Bisq is its security and incentive design for fiat‑to‑BTC P2P. Each trade locks both sides’ refundable security deposits in a 2‑of‑2 multisig escrow. Account‑age and signing rules gradually raise per‑trade limits to reduce chargeback risk, and a small amount of bitcoin is required up front to cover fees and deposits. Trading fees are transparent and lower if paid in BSQ. It’s desktop‑first by design; the mobile app is for notifications.

User feedback highlights Bisq’s strengths in privacy, censorship resistance and self‑custody, along with clear, step‑by‑step trade flows and a multi‑stage dispute process if things go wrong.

The trade‑offs are thinner liquidity depending on region, wider spreads than convenience brokers, the need to already have a little bitcoin, and settlement times tied to the chosen fiat method and counterparties’ availability. Some users note that disputes can take time, and that desktop performance varies by setup.

Bisq’s target audience is privacy‑minded bitcoiners and anyone who needs a resilient, non‑custodial fiat ramp. The roadmap is to keep the marketplace permissionless while improving UX and resilience: Bisq 2 introduces a simpler “Bisq Easy” path alongside the familiar multisig protocol, support for multiple privacy networks, and optional use of Liquid for faster, lower‑fee settlement.

tl_dr.consider_if: You are ready to learn the deposit workflow and keep a small BTC balance on hand for fees and collateral.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You need instant liquidity, mobile access, or trades without any on-chain confirmations.

micro_faqs.a: You can create a new offer with your preferred method or revisit the market later; payment method availability depends on which peers are online.

name: Bitkey

faqs.q: How does Bitkey's 2-of-3 key system keep my bitcoin safe?
faqs.a: Bitkey splits control between the mobile key on your phone, a fingerprint hardware key, and a server key, and every send or security change needs two signatures. That means Block can never move funds alone while you still have a path to recover coins if one device fails.

faqs.q: What is Bitkey's Cloud Recovery flow if I lose my phone?
faqs.a: The Bitkey app stores an encrypted copy of your mobile key inside your iCloud or Google Drive account, and the hardware key decrypts it. Install Bitkey on a new phone, sign into the same cloud account, tap the hardware key, and your wallet restores without seed phrases.

faqs.q: What happens when my Bitkey hardware is lost or damaged?
faqs.a: Start hardware recovery in the app and Bitkey triggers a seven-day security waiting period while SMS and email alerts confirm the request. After the hold, pair a replacement device or invite Recovery Contacts to approve sooner so you can co-sign again.

faqs.q: How do Recovery Contacts help if I lose my phone and hardware?
faqs.a: You can pre-approve trusted contacts in the Bitkey app, and they install Bitkey, accept your invite, and agree to vouch for you. If both keys disappear, you share a code with them, they verify it inside their app, and that lets you rebuild your wallet on new hardware.

faqs.q: When would I use the Bitkey Emergency Exit Kit?
faqs.a: The Emergency Exit Kit is a signed Android utility plus an encrypted mobile key backup stored in your cloud drive. If Bitkey's infrastructure ever goes offline, you sideload the kit, tap your hardware key, and sweep your bitcoin to any address you control.

custody_control: Shared custody: you hold two out of three keys
recovery_method: Cloud + device pairing
description:
Bitkey is a mobile and hardware wallet developed by Block and designed for people new to Bitcoin who want simple, secure self-custody. The system combines a phone app with a wireless hardware device and an encrypted cloud backup, using a 2-of-3 multisig model to keep users in control of their funds. This structure allows users to recover access even if they lose their phone or the device, adding safety without relying on seed phrases.

The hardware, a sleek hexagonal device with a fingerprint sensor and NFC for phone pairing, eliminates the need for complex seed phrases, making it user-friendly. Sending Bitcoin requires both your phone and the Bitkey device, while smaller transactions can be approved using just your phone and Bitkey's server key if you've set spending limits. This balance appeals to people who want more security than just a phone wallet but don't want the complexity of most hardware wallets.

Users can set daily spending limits for app-only transactions, adding flexibility. The setup is quick, often taking just 5 minutes, and the app's clean interface is intuitive. The app allows Bitcoin purchases, shows balance in both sats and fiat, and offers recovery through trusted contacts in case of loss. It also lacks a screen, meaning you can't visually verify addresses on the hardware itself.

Bitkey's mission is to bring secure Bitcoin ownership to a global audience, especially those new to Bitcoin, by removing friction and avoiding the pitfalls of traditional backups. Their future vision includes broader international support, expanded wallet functionality, and continued emphasis on open-source development and user control. For beginners, Bitkey offers a straightforward, secure way to own Bitcoin with a polished user experience, though advanced users may want more flexibility.

tl_dr.best_for: Bitcoin savers who want Block's hardware + app bundle so they can hold two of three keys without memorizing a seed phrase.
tl_dr.consider_if: You want NFC hardware, cloud backups, Recovery Contacts, inheritance tooling, and an emergency exit if Block ever goes dark.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You prefer a screen-based hardware wallet, DIY multisig, or Lightning support today.

steps.title: 1. Choose policy & secure keys/backups
actions: Pair the hardware key via NFC, enroll your fingerprint, and verify the encrypted mobile key backup saved to your cloud drive.

steps.gotcha: The hardware key has no screen; always confirm addresses on your phone or connected node.

steps.title: 2. Prove the setup
actions: Generate a receive address, send a small test (~10k sats), and wait for Security hub to confirm the deposit.
Simulate one failure: run Cloud Recovery on a spare phone, start hardware replacement to see the seven-day hold, or test the Emergency Exit Kit offline.
Wipe the spare device after the drill and log what you learned in your vault documentation.
steps.gotcha: Skipping the drill leaves recovery timing a mystery; practice now so you trust it under pressure.

steps.title: 3. Operationalize safety
actions: Set mobile send limits so only pocket money leaves with the phone; larger amounts require the hardware key or Recovery Contacts.
Enable push, SMS, and email alerts for sends, recovery attempts, and inheritance events.
Invite your Inheritance beneficiary, document the six-month timer, and store key locations plus contact instructions in a safe place.
steps.gotcha: Stale instructions turn convenience into a choke point; update the log when you travel or rotate devices.

micro_faqs.a: Yes. Advanced settings let you point the app at your full node or Electrum server so addresses and history sync privately.

micro_faqs.a: The kit runs on Android, so keep access to a spare Android device even if your daily driver is iOS.

recovery_heading: If this happens, can I still move my Bitcoin?

recovery_explainers.why: An encrypted copy of your mobile key lives in your own cloud account, and your hardware key decrypts it. You can restore the wallet on a new phone without memorizing a seed phrase.
how: Install Bitkey on a new phone and sign into the same iCloud or Google Drive account.
Approve the cloud access prompt, then tap your hardware key to decrypt the backup.
Wait for the wallet to resync and verify the balance.
recovery_explainers.gotcha: Cloud Recovery needs the hardware key, so keep it safe and separate from your phone.

recovery_explainers.why: Bitkey triggers a seven-day security hold when you report lost hardware, giving you time to cancel if someone else made the request. Recovery Contacts can vouch for you to skip the waiting period.
how: Open the app, start hardware recovery, and watch for SMS and email alerts confirming the request.
Wait seven days for the hold to clear, or share a code with your Recovery Contacts to speed it up.
Pair the new hardware key and transfer your wallet to the fresh device.
recovery_explainers.gotcha: If you lose both phone and hardware, Recovery Contacts become your only path; invite them during setup.

recovery_explainers.why: Bitkey holds only one of three keys. You control two keys, so you can always move bitcoin without the server—either by co-signing with your mobile and hardware keys, or by using the Emergency Exit Kit if their infrastructure goes offline.
how: If the server is online: open the Bitkey app, generate a receive address in another wallet, and use your mobile key plus hardware key to co-sign the send.

If the server is offline or compromised: download the Emergency Exit Kit from Security hub, verify the SHA256 checksum, sideload the APK onto an Android device, tap your hardware key, and sweep your balance.
Confirm the transaction on-chain to complete the exit.
recovery_explainers.gotcha: The Emergency Exit Kit only runs on Android, so plan access to an Android device before an emergency. Different people draw different lines about how much to keep with a third-party key holder; you can choose differently.

recovery_explainers.why: When you set up Bitkey, you can invite trusted contacts who download the app and agree to help you recover. If you lose your phone and hardware, your contacts verify a code inside their app so you can rebuild the wallet on new devices.
how: Download the Bitkey app on a new phone and start the recovery process for both devices.
Share a verification code with your Recovery Contacts through a separate channel.
Once they approve the request in their app, recover your mobile key from the cloud and pair a new hardware key.
Transfer your wallet balance to the fresh device setup.
recovery_explainers.gotcha: Recovery Contacts are your only path when both devices are gone; invite them during initial setup and confirm they still have access annually.

description:
Bitonic is the oldest and largest Bitcoin-only broker in the Netherlands, founded in 2012, with a reputation for reliability and simplicity. They offer fast, automatic Bitcoin delivery via iDEAL, SEPA, and Bancontact, and their fully automated system ensures quick transfers.

It stands out with its direct purchase model, selling Bitcoin from its own stock for instant delivery and transparent pricing, avoiding third-party intermediaries. Bitonic offers buying, selling, and saving Bitcoin via iDEAL, SEPA, or Bancontact and provide an Auto Invest savings feature, allowing users to easily set up recurring Bitcoin purchases, (though only up to €250 | 271,023 sats) and a business solution for Bitcoin payments.

Its app, rated 4.5 stars on iOS, is praised for its clean, no-nonsense design, though some users report slow verification. The platform uses multi-signature cold storage for security and encourages self-custody with personal wallets.

Their vision focuses on making Bitcoin accessible and easy for Dutch and European users, backed by education through Bitonic Academy and news via Bitcoin.nl. Overall, Bitonic is ideal for beginners who want a reliable, no-altcoin platform in Europe, with fast transactions, clear pricing and a strong local support.
recovery_method: Email login with password resets via the account portal and support-assisted review when needed.

tl_dr.best_for: Dutch and EU savers who want bitcoin-only buys with iDEAL and a fee-free monthly allowance.
tl_dr.consider_if: You want bundled payouts that batch miner fees before moving sats to cold storage.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You need Lightning withdrawals or non-EU payment rails.

steps.title: 1. Create and verify your account
actions: Visit Bitonic's Create account page and choose the personal or business flow.
Accept the User Agreement and appendices, then submit your email and password.
Upload the requested identity documents and confirm your IBAN so compliance can approve you.
steps.gotcha: Verification can require additional documents, so keep your ID and proof of address nearby.

steps.title: 2. Link your bank and schedule funding
actions: Add your EU bank account in the Bitonic app or dashboard.
For Auto Invest, set up a recurring SEPA transfer from your bank to Bitonic's IBAN.
If you prefer manual buys, prepare an iDEAL, Bancontact, or SEPA deposit to match your plan.
steps.gotcha: Manual SEPA deposits take about one business day to clear before you can withdraw the resulting bitcoin.

steps.title: 3. Buy and move sats to your wallet
steps.why: Your goal is to convert euros to bitcoin and reduce time in custody.
actions: Choose Buy Bitcoin, enter your amount, or confirm your Auto Invest plan.
Select 'My own wallet' to paste a fresh address or keep funds in Bitonic temporarily.
Watch for the on-chain transaction and log it in your wallet once it confirms.
steps.gotcha: Dynamic miner fees apply to every withdrawal, and urgent euro payouts cost 0.25% (minimum €7.50).

micro_faqs.q: How long does Bitonic verification usually take?
micro_faqs.a: Most accounts are approved within minutes through the app, but manual review can extend the process if compliance needs extra documents.

micro_faqs.q: When will my Auto Invest transfer convert to bitcoin?
micro_faqs.a: Bitonic converts your standing SEPA payment as soon as the transfer arrives, then emails a receipt detailing the rate, fee allowance, and miner fee.

micro_faqs.q: Can I update my withdrawal address after scheduling a purchase?
micro_faqs.a: Yes. Edit the destination under Auto Invest or on the order form before the payout triggers so Bitonic pushes coins to the correct wallet.

tiles.title: 1. Choose your cold storage
tiles.why: Cold storage keeps bitcoin offline so exchange failures cannot touch it.
actions: Pick a hardware or multisig wallet that matches your experience.
Initialize it offline and record the seed on paper or steel.
Store backups in separate safe locations.
tiles.gotcha: Never photograph or email your seed phrase; offline copies are the only safe option.

tiles.title: 2. Add wallet address to Bitonic
tiles.why: Linking your address turns every purchase into an automatic withdrawal.
actions: Generate a fresh receive address from your cold storage wallet.
In Bitonic, choose "My own wallet" and paste the address carefully.
Label the address in your wallet so you can confirm incoming funds later.
tiles.gotcha: Double-check the pasted address and consider a second device for verification to avoid clipboard malware.

tiles.title: 3. Send a test withdrawal
tiles.why: A small test confirms your address and workflow before larger amounts.
actions: Buy a small amount of bitcoin or use part of your Auto Invest allowance.
Trigger a withdrawal to your fresh address and note the transaction ID.
Wait for one confirmation and verify the balance inside your wallet.
tiles.gotcha: Choose a standard fee tier so the test confirms within an hour without overpaying.

tiles.title: 4. Bundle and sweep the rest
tiles.why: Bundled purchases reduce miner fees while automating self-custody exits.
actions: Enable bundled purchases in the Bitonic app and set your satoshi threshold.
Confirm the destination address before the bundle triggers.
After the sweep arrives, update your records and generate a new address for the next cycle.
tiles.gotcha: While funds are bundling they remain on Bitonic, so choose a threshold that balances fee savings with your appetite for custodial exposure.

name: Breez

faqs.q: What fees apply when I pay over Lightning?
faqs.a: Breez passes along the network's routing fees (like a toll) and lets you cap them under Preferences > Lightning Fees; the app itself doesn't add extra charges to everyday sends.

faqs.q: What happens if I don't have enough capacity to receive?
faqs.a: Breez automatically sets up a new channel for you and charges 0.4% of the amount plus the current Bitcoin network fee when more capacity is needed.

faqs.q: How does Breez back up my wallet?
faqs.a: Each time you make a payment or generate an address, Breez encrypts your channel data and saves it to your cloud account (Google Drive, iCloud, Nextcloud, or any WebDAV provider) so you can restore everything if you lose your phone.

faqs.q: How can I restore Breez after losing my phone?
faqs.a: Install Breez on your new device, sign in with the recovery key and cloud account you set up, then keep the app open while it downloads your backup and rebuilds your channels.

faqs.q: Does Breez support on-chain transactions?
faqs.a: Yes. Breez uses submarine swaps so you can receive to a Bitcoin address or send out to on-chain wallets while keeping a single Lightning balance.

supported_network: Lightning only, with on-chain deposits and withdrawals via submarine swaps

recovery_method: Encrypted cloud backup + Breez recovery key
description:
Breez is a beginner-friendly Lightning wallet designed to make everyday bitcoin payments effortless on mobile. The app runs a Lightning node behind the scenes, pairing a simple interface with automatic channel management so anyone can spend or receive sats in seconds.

Beyond standard wallet features, Breez adds a merchant-focused Point-of-Sale mode, podcast streaming with bitcoin tips, and one-tap Lightning addresses. Instant channel setups and automatic swaps keep the experience seamless while Breez encrypts your channel data to your cloud account after every payment.

Compared with Phoenix's recovery phrase backups or Muun's dual on-chain approach, Breez focuses on automation: it handles all the technical channel work for you, but requires encrypted cloud backups and charges a 0.4% setup fee when new receiving capacity is needed.

tl_dr.best_for: Mobile Lightning payments with auto-managed channels, POS tools, and podcast streaming.
tl_dr.consider_if: You want to accept sats in a shop or stream payments to creators without running nodes manually.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You avoid cloud backups, need desktop access, or demand ultra-low inbound fees.

steps.title: 1. Install and secure Breez
actions: Install Breez from the App Store or Google Play
Set a PIN or biometric lock under Preferences > Security & Backup
Link a cloud provider and write down your Breez recovery key offline
steps.gotcha: Cloud access alone is not enough—store the recovery key somewhere offline before using real funds.

steps.title: 2. Receive your first sats

chips.cost: ~0.4% + mining fee when a new channel opens

actions: Tap Receive and choose Lightning invoice
Share the QR with your payer and keep the app awake
Let Breez set up a channel automatically if you need more capacity
steps.gotcha: Channel creation fees appear before you confirm; wait for lower mempool fees if the estimate is high.

steps.title: 3. Pay with Lightning or POS

chips.cost: Network routing fee (you set the max)

actions: Tap Send, scan a Lightning invoice or Lightning Address
Review the route fee Breez found and confirm
In POS mode, enter the amount and show the invoice QR to your customer
steps.gotcha: Large payments may need more channel space—check your available balance before charging a big order.

fees_scenarios.title: Pay someone
fees_scenarios.cost_today: Network routing fee (you set the max)
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Breez routes the payment over Lightning and finds the best available path.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Set a reasonable fee cap and avoid paying during busy network periods when finding routes is harder.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Routing fees depend on the payment path. Breez lets you control the maximum fee under Preferences > Lightning Fees so you stay in budget.

fees_scenarios.title: First time you receive
fees_scenarios.cost_today: 0.4% of the amount + small base fee + current network mining fee
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Breez sets up a new channel automatically so you have capacity to receive that payment.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Receive a meaningful amount on your first payment and wait for quieter network periods to reduce the mining fee portion.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: The fee covers Breez funding a new channel on the Bitcoin network. It only applies when your wallet needs more receiving capacity.

fees_scenarios.title: Send to a Bitcoin address
fees_scenarios.cost_today: 0.5% swap fee + mining fee (via swap partner)
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Breez converts your Lightning balance into an on-chain Bitcoin transaction automatically.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Combine withdrawals and wait for low-fee periods; swaps need at least 50k sats and cost more when the network is busy.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: A swap partner handles the conversion for Breez. Expect a 0.5% service fee plus the current Bitcoin network mining fee.

fees_faq.q: Does Breez charge every time I receive Lightning payments?
fees_faq.a: No. Once your channel has capacity, receives are free apart from normal network routing fees; the 0.4% setup fee applies only when you need more receiving capacity.

fees_faq.q: Can I limit how much a payment costs to send?
fees_faq.a: Yes. Use Preferences > Lightning Fees to set your own caps so Breez will only send payments within your budget.

fees_faq.q: What happens if a swap to Bitcoin is too expensive?
fees_faq.a: Wait for lower network fees or send the funds over Lightning instead—swaps to on-chain Bitcoin inherit the network's mining costs.

key_terms.definition: A Lightning channel that Breez opens automatically without waiting for network confirmations so you can receive payments right away.
Converts your Lightning balance into an on-chain Bitcoin payment using a trustless escrow.
Breez saves your encrypted channel data to your cloud account so you can restore everything if you lose your device.

data_flows: Breez connects to Breez's service to route Lightning payments, so the operator can see payment amounts and timing needed to keep channels working.
Swaps to on-chain Bitcoin show up as public Bitcoin transactions that include your chosen swap amount.
Your encrypted channel data sits with your cloud provider, though they cannot read it without your recovery key.
Lightning network nodes in the payment path still see metadata (amount, timing, routing hints) needed to forward payments.
privacy.data_flows_do: Consider connecting Breez to your own Bitcoin node when possible to limit what third parties can see.
privacy.data_flows_dont: Assume Lightning is fully private—routing still reveals payment amounts and timing to nodes along the path.
recovery: Link a cloud account (Google Drive, iCloud, Nextcloud, or any compatible service) and confirm backups work after your first payment.
Write down the Breez recovery key offline; this key decrypts your backup when you need to restore.
To restore: install Breez, sign in to the same cloud account, and enter your recovery key so the app can rebuild your channels.
If Breez or its service disappears, use the Close channels option to move funds to on-chain—wait several hours for network confirmations.
privacy.recovery_do: Test a small restore before keeping larger amounts to make sure you can access your cloud backup and recovery key.
privacy.recovery_dont: Run Breez on two phones at once; this causes conflicts and can lead to losing funds.
region: App-store listings and Lightning connectivity vary by country—check if Breez is available in your region before recommending it to merchants.
If your preferred cloud service is blocked locally, switch Breez to another supported provider in Settings.

micro_faqs.q: Does Breez expose my payments to my cloud provider?
micro_faqs.a: No. Backups are encrypted on your device before upload; the provider stores encrypted data and cannot read your balances without your recovery key.

micro_faqs.q: Can Breez connect to my own Bitcoin node?
micro_faqs.a: Yes. Configure a custom node in Preferences > Network to reduce reliance on Breez's default service.

micro_faqs.q: What if Breez's service goes offline when I need funds?
micro_faqs.a: Use the Close channels option to move funds to on-chain. Settlement happens after the standard safety period of about 5 days.

migration.title: Restore Breez on a new phone
migration.choose: When your original device is lost or retired.
steps: Install Breez on the new device from the official store listing.
Select Restore, pick the same cloud provider, and enter your Breez recovery key.
Stay online while Breez downloads backups and resyncs channels before uninstalling the old copy.
migration.tips: Test the recovery flow with a small balance before storing large funds so you know the process.
migration.gotcha: Running Breez on two phones at once can desync channels—shut down the old device after the restore.

migration.title: Another wallet → to Breez
migration.choose: When you want Breez automation but currently use another Lightning wallet.
steps: Set up Breez and complete the security and backup prompts.
Create a Breez Lightning invoice for the amount you wish to move.
Pay the invoice from your old wallet, starting with a small test before larger transfers.
migration.tips: Leave both wallets open during the transfer so routes stay active and invoice timers do not expire.
migration.gotcha: Expect Breez to charge the 0.4% setup fee if the transfer needs fresh receiving capacity.

migration.title: Breez → to on-chain wallet
migration.choose: When you plan to cold-store funds on-chain.
steps: Open Settings > Close channels and choose cooperative close for the lowest fee.
Wait for the closing transaction to confirm; funds appear in Breez’s on-chain view.
Sweep the confirmed balance to your external wallet.
migration.tips: Check mempool fees before closing channels and target cheaper periods to save on miner fees.
migration.gotcha: Force-closing channels is slower (up to ~5 days) and costs more—reserve it for emergencies.

migration.title: Breez → to another Lightning wallet
migration.choose: When you want to switch to a different Lightning client.
steps: Install and secure the new wallet, including its recovery method.
Send a test Lightning payment from Breez to the new wallet to confirm connectivity.
Move the remaining balance, then close Breez channels or export funds on-chain as needed.
migration.tips: Move funds in batches if routes fail; Breez’s mission control improves with retries.
migration.gotcha: Remember to update any POS terminals or podcast splits to the new wallet’s Lightning Address.

name: BTC Pay

faqs.q: How does BTCPay Server keep invoices self-hosted?
faqs.a: BTCPay runs on hardware you control, so invoices, stores, and payment history live on your own server rather than a processor's database.

faqs.q: What are the hosting options for BTCPay Server?
faqs.a: You can deploy on a $10–$70 per month VPS, use a one-click host like LunaNode or Voltage, or install it on dedicated hardware at home.

faqs.q: Do I pay any platform fees when customers pay invoices?
faqs.a: No platform fees apply - only the Bitcoin network fees you select for on-chain payouts or the liquidity costs of your Lightning channels.

faqs.q: How do I register and secure admin access?
faqs.a: The first account on a new instance becomes the admin, so create it yourself, enable 2FA, and configure SMTP so you can recover passwords later.

faqs.q: Can BTCPay connect to my existing e-commerce stack?
faqs.a: Yes. Official plugins cover WooCommerce, Shopify via a bridge, Magento, Zapier, and dozens more, and you can run the point-of-sale or crowdfunding apps directly from BTCPay.

compatibility: Big Commerce, Drupal, Ecwid, GiveWP, Grandnode, Invoice Ninja, Magento, Nopcommerce, Odoo, OpenCart, PhocaCart, PrestaShop, Pretix, Shopify V2, Shopware, Ghost, Smartstore, VirtueMart, Wix, WooCommerce, Xenforo, Zapier, Custom Integration
description: Most payment processors hold your funds and act as a gatekeeper between you and your customers. BTC Pay Server solves this by running on your own hardware, connecting directly to your Bitcoin wallet without any middleman. That means you receive 100% of every payment instantly, with no risk of frozen accounts or leaked customer data. You can host it yourself for complete independence or use a managed cloud provider to get started quickly.
recovery_method: Server backups plus wallet keys you control

tl_dr.consider_if: You already run a node or want to consolidate Lightning, on-chain, and fiat settlement in one dashboard.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You prefer a hosted PSP that abstracts server maintenance and upgrades.

howto.title: Go live with Bitcoin payments in 4 steps:

steps.title: 1. Deploy your server
steps.sync_time: Depends on your Bitcoin node backend
actions: Pick a deployment path from Docker, managed host, or hardware builds and provision the VM or device.
Run the configurator, point DNS at your server, and confirm HTTPS is working before exposing the dashboard.
Create the first account yourself - the docs note it becomes the admin - and store the credentials in a password manager.
steps.gotcha: The first registered user gains admin rights, so finish setup before inviting teammates.

steps.title: 2. Connect your store or POS
actions: Create your first store, choose the default currency, and name the point of sale profile.
Install plugins such as WooCommerce, Shopify bridge, or the built-in Point of Sale app to link your checkout surface.
Enable Server Settings → Policies if you need to allow staff accounts on the instance.
steps.gotcha: Stores stay inactive until at least one payment method is configured, so finish the wallet hookup next.

steps.title: 3. Configure Bitcoin settlement

cards.title: Custody
cards.explanation: BTC Pay generates new addresses from your wallet's public key for every order. That means funds go straight to your cold storage without ever touching a company's ledger. You verify the receipt on your own node, so you never have to trust a dashboard.

cards.title: Data Privacy
cards.explanation: You host the database, so customer names and order details never leave your server. That means no third party can mine your sales data or track your customers. You can wipe the logs whenever you want.

cards.title: Jurisdiction & Availability
cards.explanation: BTCPay is open-source code, not a company, so it exists everywhere the internet does. Your 'jurisdiction' is simply where you put the server—your home, a VPS in Switzerland, or a cloud in New York. You choose the legal environment that fits your business by selecting the physical location of your hardware.

cards.title: Compliance
cards.explanation: Because you are the payment processor, there is no onboarding department to demand a passport or business license. You can accept payments instantly from anywhere in the world without waiting for approval. You decide which compliance tools (like travel rule reports) to enable based on your local laws.

cards.title: Operational Risk
cards.explanation: Sovereignty means the buck stops with you. There is no support desk to reverse a transaction or reset a lost seed phrase. You must secure your backups (wallet seeds + channel states) and admin credentials like a bank vault, because in this model, you are the bank.

micro_faqs.q: Can BTCPay see my customers' private data?
micro_faqs.a: Only the data you store on your server is available, so limit invoice metadata to what you truly need.

micro_faqs.q: Is Tor supported?
micro_faqs.a: Yes. Deployment guides cover Tor exposure so you can reach the dashboard without opening ports on clearnet.

faqs.q: How do Bull Bitcoin's buy and sell rates include fees?
faqs.a: Bull Bitcoin publishes an all-in CAD rate on its Rates page that already bakes in the spread, so the quote you confirm is what lands in your wallet. If you expect to cross $100,000 CAD in monthly volume you can request Bull Bitcoin Prime for tighter pricing.

faqs.q: How fast do Interac e-Transfer buys reach my wallet on Bull Bitcoin?
faqs.a: As soon as Bull Bitcoin receives your Interac e-Transfer it broadcasts the payout over on-chain, Lightning, or Liquid, so the sats arrive within minutes. Pick the network before you confirm if you need instant Lightning delivery.

faqs.q: Does Bull Bitcoin require identity verification before I trade?
faqs.a: Bull Bitcoin is a FINTRAC-regulated MSB, which means you verify your ID and account before funding or requesting CAD payouts. Completing that step keeps them compliant while every buy still settles straight to your wallet.

faqs.q: What payout options can I use when I sell bitcoin on Bull Bitcoin?
faqs.a: Bull Bitcoin locks your sell rate the moment your bitcoin arrives and can send CAD to a bank account, Interac recipient, credit card, or more than 14,000 Canadian billers. You can route the payout to yourself or nominate a third-party recipient inside Canada.

faqs.q: Can Bull Bitcoin deliver bitcoin over Lightning or the Liquid Network?
faqs.a: Bull Bitcoin lets you paste a Bitcoin address, Lightning invoice, or Liquid address when you place a buy, so it settles on the network you choose. Use on-chain for larger orders and Lightning or Liquid when speed matters.

description:
Bull Bitcoin is a Canadian Bitcoin exchange that stands out by being entirely non-custodial, meaning users must provide their own wallet and take full ownership of their Bitcoin. It allows users to buy Bitcoin directly to their own wallets, sell Bitcoin instantly without waiting for confirmations, and even pay bills, rent, and credit cards in Canada by converting Bitcoin to fiat without relying on traditional banks. This approach positions Bitcoin as a tool for everyday exchange, not just long-term saving.

The platform (the mobile app is in beta) is self-funded, Bitcoin-only, and deeply ideological, rejecting external investors. Its team identifies as cypherpunks, building open-source tools and promoting financial sovereignty. Bull Bitcoin's mission is to create sovereign individuals through uncompromising adherence to Bitcoin principles, making it attractive to users who want to align their actions with their values.

Beginners find the platform easy to use, with a clean interface and responsive support, while advanced users appreciate its strong privacy stance and no-compromise philosophy. It's ideal for Canadians and expanding internationally for those who want full control over their Bitcoin without depending on custodians or legacy finance systems.

tl_dr.consider_if: You need Lightning or Liquid settlement and want live human support before moving larger wire transfers.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You are outside Bull Bitcoin's supported regions or prefer leaving funds on a custodial exchange.

name: Fold

faqs.q: How do Fold rewards differ by plan?
faqs.a: Fold's Basic plan lets you spin the Rewards Wheel, buy gift cards, and refer friends for sats, while Fold+ subscribers add guaranteed 0.5% back on signature Visa purchases, 1.5%-5% rotating Card and Merchant Boosts, and ACH Bill Pay rewards.

faqs.q: How do ACH Bill Pay rewards work?
faqs.a: Fold+ members earn 0.25%-1.5% back on ACH Bill Payments up to the amount of the previous month's qualified spend-the first $2,500 in payments uses your tier rate, dollars $2,501-$5,000 revert to 0.25%, and anything beyond last month's spend earns 0%. Qualified spend includes bitcoin buys, gift cards purchased with your Fold balance (counted 2x), and Visa Signature transactions that only received the base 0.5% reward.

faqs.q: What limits apply to the Fold Card?
faqs.a: As of September 5, 2024 the Fold Card caps include a $30,000 account balance, $15,000 per-day spend, $15,000 per calendar-day loads, a $2,000 rolling 24-hour gift card limit, and $250 per ATM transaction ($1,000 per day/month). Instant debit transfers cap at $1,500 per deposit and depend on how long you have held Fold+.

faqs.q: Is the Fold Card FDIC insured?
faqs.a: USD on the Fold Card is issued by Sutton Bank, Member FDIC, so balances qualify for pass-through FDIC insurance up to $250,000 per ownership category when eligibility conditions are met. Bitcoin balances, rewards, and gift card value are not FDIC or SIPC protected.

faqs.q: How long does Push to Card take and what does it cost?
faqs.a: Push to Card sells bitcoin inside Fold and loads USD to your Fold Card; Fold+ members pay no fee, Basic users pay a 1% sell fee, and transfers usually settle in 1-10 minutes (rarely up to 24 hours).

faqs.q: How do I withdraw bitcoin from Fold?
faqs.a: Open the Bitcoin tab, tap Send -> Withdraw, paste or scan your destination address, and confirm; the only cost is the Bitcoin network miner fee. Most withdrawals finalize within 1-2 hours, and Fold asks you to contact support if a transfer hasn't landed after 24 hours.

It offers a Visa prepaid debit card, gift card purchases, and bill payments, all rewarding users with Bitcoin (sats). Users can also buy Bitcoin with low or no fees, depending on their plan, and deposit Bitcoin into their Fold account for insured custody.

What sets Fold apart is how it combines traditional finance functions like bill pay and debit card usage with Bitcoin rewards in one simple interface. Users don't need to juggle multiple apps or wallets. Rewards can be earned on nearly every transaction, from daily spending to mortgage payments, with bonus sats for gift card purchases. Fold also allows external Bitcoin deposits and provides low-fee conversions from paycheck to BTC, making it easy to live on a Bitcoin standard while minimizing taxable events.

Users praise the ease of use, the ability to stack Bitcoin passively, and the clear design of the app. Some power users run most of their household finances through Fold, using the gift card section for groceries and shopping, and setting up recurring buys with leftover balances at the end of each month. The ability to earn rewards even on ACH bill pay is seen as a unique benefit.

Fold's vision is to be the ultimate platform for living on a Bitcoin standard, making it easy to earn, spend, and save Bitcoin while navigating a fiat world, giving users control and flexibility without the complexity of traditional exchanges or wallets.

faqs.q: How do Hodl Hodl trading fees work?
faqs.a: Hodl Hodl caps its trading fee at 0.5% and splits it equally between the buyer and seller when the contract closes. You see the fee in the contract preview before you lock funds so you can decide whether the price still fits your trade.

faqs.q: Does Hodl Hodl require KYC verification?
faqs.a: Hodl Hodl lets you sign up with an email and start trading without submitting identity documents. Higher reputation still helps your pricing, so you can choose optional verification only if counterparties request it.

faqs.q: How does Hodl Hodl multisig escrow keep trades secure?
faqs.a: Each trade locks bitcoin in a unique 2-of-3 multisig address controlled by you, the counterparty, and Hodl Hodl support. If a dispute happens, either you or support can co-sign the release so the contract settles even if the site goes offline.

faqs.q: What payment methods can I use on Hodl Hodl?
faqs.a: Sellers post over 1,000 payment methods ranging from bank transfers and Wise to cash in person, with availability filtered by currency and country. You can sort offers by payment type to match whatever rails you already trust.

faqs.q: What are Hodl Hodl trading limits and how do I increase them?
faqs.a: New accounts start on the first limit tier with smaller trade caps until you complete contracts and earn reviews. As your reputation score climbs you unlock higher daily and lifetime limits, and you can request manual increases for high volume deals.

WW.text: Required to build reputation on closed platform

recovery_method: Email login with optional 2FA, Trusted Devices, and support mediated account recovery
description:
Hodl Hodl is a peer-to-peer Bitcoin marketplace that removes the custodial step most exchanges require. When you buy or sell on a typical platform, the exchange holds your funds and decides when you can withdraw. That reintroduces the same counterparty risk Bitcoin was designed to eliminate. Hodl Hodl takes a different approach: each trade locks bitcoin in a 2-of-3 multisig escrow that you, the counterparty, and Hodl Hodl support control together. Neither side can move the funds alone, which means trades settle directly between wallets without Hodl Hodl ever holding custody. That shifts trust from a centralized company to verifiable on-chain contracts.

You can sign up with an email and start trading without submitting identity documents. Hodl Hodl supports over 100 fiat currencies and lets sellers post offers using bank transfers, cash in person, Revolut, PayPal, and other payment rails you already trust. Premiums vary by offer and tend to be higher for new accounts until you complete a few trades and build reputation. The platform uses a limit tier system: as your reputation score grows through successful contracts and reviews, you unlock higher daily and lifetime trading caps.

The web interface is straightforward. You filter offers by country, currency, and payment method, read the seller's instructions, and open a contract. Both parties chat inside the contract, upload payment proof, and coordinate the release once fiat clears. If something breaks, you can open a dispute and Hodl Hodl support co-signs the multisig based on the evidence. A Testnet environment lets you rehearse the full workflow with valueless coins before risking real sats, so you learn the escrow flow, chat prompts, and dispute process without capital at stake.

Hodl Hodl fits users who want non-custodial trading and are comfortable managing their own wallets, confirming payments, and negotiating premiums. You bring your own Bitcoin wallet to every trade, which means no withdrawal limits or custodial freezes. The trade-off is that you handle more of the process yourself compared to a custodial exchange that automates order matching and holds funds. Choose Hodl Hodl when self-custody and privacy matter more than instant card funding or automated recurring buys.

fees_faq.a: The seller covers the on-chain fee to fund escrow and can choose the release fee, while the buyer only pays their own wallet fee if they move coins again.

fees_faq.q: When does Hodl Hodl charge the 0.5% fee?
fees_faq.a: The fee is withheld from the escrow release once both parties confirm payment, so no extra invoice or deposit is needed.

name: Lightspark

faqs.q: How do Lightspark Connect fees work across Starter and Enterprise tiers?
faqs.a: Connect Starter routes every Lightning payment through Lightspark's managed nodes for 0.50% up to $300,000 in monthly volume. Enterprise plans add a $9,000-$15,000 platform retainer so you can drop per-transaction costs to roughly 0.30%-0.15% across $3-$15 million in monthly flow. You can start on Starter's free first 30 days and upgrade inside the dashboard once usage grows.

faqs.q: When does Lightspark bill me for platform and overage fees?
faqs.a: Billing kicks in after the 30-day trial, when Lightspark invoices the platform fee for your tier at the beginning of each month. That same invoice lists any usage that exceeded your volume limits in the prior period so finance teams see one predictable charge. You can downgrade or pause before the next cycle if your run rate changes.

faqs.q: How can I pay my Lightspark invoice?
faqs.a: Lightspark charges the card you keep on file five days after issuing the invoice, which removes manual payment work. Each invoice also includes a Lightning or on-chain Bitcoin link that locks the fiat amount in sats for 24 hours so you can settle with bitcoin instead. You can regenerate the payment quote from the invoice link whenever the price window expires.

faqs.q: How do I make payments from Lightspark?
faqs.a: Lightning payouts run through the Send flow or API/SDK while on-chain settlements use the Withdraw flow, so you choose the rail per transfer. That separation keeps instant Lightning transfers distinct from Bitcoin Layer 1 withdrawals that wait on block confirmations. You can set custom fee limits in the Send flow when you need to allow higher routing budgets.

faqs.q: What protects my funds if Lightspark goes offline?
faqs.a: Passwords are recoverable through the Forgot your password link, but custody resilience comes from Lightspark's Funds Recovery Kit that generates pre-signed transactions. Once you configure the kit you can publish those transactions on Bitcoin Layer 1 to reclaim funds without waiting on Lightspark support. Treat the hosted stack as a bridge and store the recovery file offline so you always have an exit.

description:
Lightspark is a payments infrastructure company founded by David Marcus (formerly of PayPal, Meta, and Diem) in 2022. They aim to build what they call the "Money Grid," a global, open payment network using Bitcoin as a neutral settlement layer and leveraging Lightning for high-speed transfers.

Their target audience includes enterprises—digital banks, fintechs, wallets, exchanges—that need to move money across currencies and jurisdictions instantly and cheaply, as well as developers building Bitcoin-native payment applications or self-custodial wallets that need scalable infrastructure.

What sets Lightspark apart is their end-to-end product integration, combining seamless liquidity management, intelligent routing, compliance-ready infrastructure, and human-friendly Universal Money Address (UMA) tech. This abstraction lets banks, wallets, exchanges, and businesses effortlessly send and receive fiat or crypto globally without having to manage Lightning channels, cross-border FX, or complex on-chain details. These tools have already seen traction with big regulated partners and typically involves KYC via the partner.

Looking forward, Lightspark's vision is to scale the Money Grid globally—connecting all real-time payment systems and making Bitcoin native rails for everything from everyday consumer transfers to B2B fiat-fiat flows. Spark aims to resolve key Lightning limitations like self-custody economic scalability and lacks native token support. By building Spark open-source and fully backward compatible with Lightning, they hope to decentralize stablecoin issuance on Bitcoin and finally realize high-velocity, global Bitcoin-based payment settlement.

faqs.q: What is Muun Wallet?
faqs.a: Muun is a non‑custodial Bitcoin and Lightning wallet that chooses the best network automatically for each payment.

faqs.q: How does Muun backup work?
faqs.a: Muun uses an email and encrypted recovery code instead of a traditional 12‑word seed phrase.

faqs.q: Is Muun open source?
faqs.a: Yes. Muun is open‑source and widely reviewed by the community.

faqs.q: What is Muun's 2-of-2 multisig model?
faqs.a: Muun requires two signatures to spend: one from your phone and one from Muun's server, ensuring both security and convenience for daily transactions.

faqs.q: How can I restore Muun after losing my phone?
faqs.a: Use your Emergency Kit PDF combined with your Recovery Code to restore full access; both pieces are required.

description:
Muun is a non-custodial Bitcoin and Lightning wallet focused on giving users full control with minimal complexity. It separates itself from other wallets through its unique security and backup model: users recover access using an email, password, and encrypted recovery code—removing the need to manage a traditional 12-word seed phrase. This makes onboarding easier for beginners without compromising self-custody.

Muun's key differentiator is how it handles both Lightning and on-chain Bitcoin in one seamless balance. Users don't have to manage channels or worry about liquidity—Muun automates that behind the scenes. You can send or receive Bitcoin however you want, and the wallet figures out whether to use Lightning or regular Bitcoin based on speed, cost, and availability. This hybrid approach appeals to users who want convenience but still own their funds.

Users praise Muun for its simple design, clear recovery process, and solid privacy. It's especially recommended for first-time users who want a secure but low-friction experience. However, some note that Muun doesn't support Lightning addresses and that Lightning transactions may route via on-chain swaps. This means unpredictable fees, especially when onchain activity rises.

Muun's mission is to provide a simple, secure way to use Bitcoin daily without needing technical knowledge. It prioritizes non-custodial access, user control, and cross-platform consistency, helping new users enter Bitcoin while retaining ownership from day one.

tl_dr.best_for: Beginners who want automatic network selection and no manual channel management.
tl_dr.consider_if: You want both Lightning and on-chain in one seamless balance without technical complexity.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You need Lightning addresses or want predictable low fees during high on-chain activity.

fees_faq.a: Muun uses submarine swaps to provide seamless Lightning payments without manual channel management. This convenience comes with potentially higher fees when on-chain activity is high.

fees_faq.q: How does Muun's fee estimator work?
fees_faq.a: Muun uses a mempool-based estimator that looks at current network conditions, not past blocks. This helps you pay efficient fees—not overpaying when the network is quiet, nor underestimating when it's busy.

fees_faq.q: Can I control whether Muun uses Lightning or on-chain?
fees_faq.a: Muun automatically chooses the best method based on the payment type and network conditions. You'll see the fee estimate before confirming.

faqs.q: How do MyNode hardware options compare between Model One and Model Two?
faqs.a: Model One bundles the single-board computer, SSD enclosure, and cabling so you plug it in and let it sync, while Model Two adds internal NVMe storage, a power button, and more CPU headroom for heavy apps. Pick the chassis that matches how much routing, indexing, or marketplace usage you expect to run.

faqs.q: Is MyNode free or do I need a Premium license?
faqs.a: The Community Edition download is free and already runs the Bitcoin, Lightning, and Tor stack, and the $79 Premium key unlocks extra marketplace apps, VPN profiles, and direct support. You can start with the free build and upgrade later without reinstalling.

faqs.q: How long does the initial MyNode sync take?
faqs.a: MyNode verifies every block from genesis on your hardware, so Raspberry Pi builds often need six or more days before Bitcoin Core reaches tip. Leave it wired and powered 24/7 or move to an x86 mini PC if you want that first sync to finish faster.

faqs.q: What default credentials and product keys should I expect on first boot?
faqs.a: The dashboard lives at mynode.local with `admin` / `bolt` as the default login and immediately asks for your product key or the Community Edition option, so anyone on your LAN could log in until you change it. Swap the password, store the key safely, and only then expose Tor or VPN access.

faqs.q: How do I reach MyNode remotely once it is online?
faqs.a: MyNode generates Tor onion links and downloadable VPN profiles so you can reach Ride The Lightning or the main UI without opening clearnet ports. Import the OpenVPN file or use the Tor URL in your wallet when you need to manage channels away from home.

steps.title: 1. Download and flash the image
actions: Grab the latest myNode image for your hardware (Model One, Model Two, Pi, or x86).
Flash it to a microSD or USB drive with Balena Etcher, then attach the SSD that will hold the blockchain.
Label the boot media and the SSD so you can keep track of them during future migrations.
steps.gotcha: Slow cards or USB2 enclosures throttle initial sync speeds; use SSDs and USB 3.

steps.title: 2. Wire up the hardware
actions: Insert the SSD into the enclosure, plug it into the USB 3 port, and verify every connector is fully seated.
Connect Ethernet between the node and your router or switch; Wi-Fi is not supported.
Plug the power supply into the outlet and the device; Model Two also needs a tap on the power button.
steps.gotcha: Power cycling without a proper shutdown can corrupt the drive; use the UI to shut down first.

steps.title: 3. Complete onboarding at mynode.local
actions: Visit `http://mynode.local/` (or the IP address) and log in with `admin` / `bolt`.
Enter your product key for Premium or choose Community Edition to keep things free.
Change the default password, record it in a password manager, and decide whether you want Tor or VPN enabled yet.
steps.gotcha: Leaving `admin` / `bolt` in place means anyone on your LAN can control the box.

steps.title: 4. Let it sync and secure services
actions: Watch Bitcoin Core reach 100% before funding Lightning or pairing wallets.
Install or unlock the bundled apps you need (Ride The Lightning, Mempool, Electrs, VPN).
Download your Lightning channel backup and a system backup once you're happy with the setup.
steps.gotcha: Do not fund Lightning until Bitcoin Core is fully synced; invoices fail when the base node lags.

migration.choose: Use this when migrating from another node so you don’t redownload the blockchain.
steps: Shut down the old node and copy `blocks` + `chainstate` to external storage.
Place the data inside `/mnt/hdd/mynode/bitcoin` on the new drive and ensure ownership belongs to the `bitcoin` user.
Boot myNode and let Bitcoin Core verify the copied data before turning Lightning back on.
migration.tips: Match pruning mode between the old and new installs; full-history data cannot satisfy a pruned node.
migration.gotcha: Power loss during the copy can corrupt LevelDB; verify with `bitcoin-cli getblockcount` before swapping disks.

migration.title: Migrate Lightning channels
migration.choose: Use this after hardware failure or when moving from Community Edition to Premium hardware.
steps: Download the latest `channel.backup` from your old node.
Install myNode on the replacement hardware, open Lightning, and upload the backup file.
Wait for on-chain settlements, then re-open channels once balances settle.
migration.tips: Keep backups on multiple media so you are never stuck with the copy on the failed drive.
migration.gotcha: Running two LND instances with the same seed will desync channels; only restore once.

migration.title: Upgrade to a larger SSD
migration.choose: Use this when you are close to filling the internal SSD or want room for more apps.
steps: Shut down myNode and connect both the old and new SSD to a computer.
Clone `/mnt/hdd/mynode` to the new drive with `rsync -aHAX` or your favorite disk tool.
Update mounts or UUIDs, connect the new drive to your node, and boot.
migration.tips: Use powered USB enclosures when cloning NVMe drives so they don’t brown out mid-transfer.
migration.gotcha: Forgetting to update fstab leaves myNode writing to the old disk; double-check paths before rebooting.

name: OpenNode

faqs.q: How does OpenNode's hosted checkout work?
faqs.a: When you create a charge, OpenNode returns a checkout URL that bundles the Lightning invoice and on-chain address so customers can choose their rail. That means you can simply redirect to checkout.opennode.com/{id} and append ln or hf query switches to shape the experience.

faqs.q: What fees does OpenNode charge for processing and withdrawals?
faqs.a: OpenNode charges around 1% for processing plus on-demand on-chain withdrawals, while scheduled weekly transfers stay free and Lightning withdrawals are free. You can choose instant payouts when speed matters or lean on scheduled moves if you want to avoid the extra fee.

faqs.q: How does OpenNode handle underpaid invoices?
faqs.a: You can set an underpayment tolerance so slightly short on-chain payments move forward automatically, and anything below the threshold is flagged as underpaid. Buyers can send the remaining sats or request a refund that returns their funds minus the 200 sat network fee, so you stay in control of the customer experience.

faqs.q: Can OpenNode pay Lightning invoices from my fiat balance?
faqs.a: Yes. Wire fiat into your OpenNode local currency wallet and initiate Lightning or on-chain payouts directly from that balance. The platform quotes the BTC amount and handles conversion so you can fund global payouts without ever holding bitcoin on your books.

faqs.q: What verification does OpenNode require?
faqs.a: Individual accounts submit government ID plus a fresh selfie, while businesses provide formation docs, ownership records, and proof of address so OpenNode can meet KYB obligations. That onboarding is what unlocks higher limits, fiat rails, and access to payout APIs.

WW.text: Fees can add up for high-volume businesses

description:
OpenNode is a Bitcoin-first payment processor that empowers businesses to accept and send Bitcoin—either on-chain or via Lightning—using simple plugins, hosted checkouts, or its developer-friendly API. Organisations that want a turnkey, compliant solution—especially mid-sized to large enterprises—can onboard easily with KYC and achieve global scale without building complex node infrastructure.

It offers instant, low-cost microtransactions with a focus on liquidity management, channel operations, and protocol support. For merchants, this means accessing Bitcoin payments both instantly and economically, alongside automatic settlement options in fiat or BTC. By abstracting away technical complexities like node handling, liquidity, and channel balance, OpenNode allows businesses to plug-and-play and scale efficiently.

It holds US regulatory licenses, manages KYC requirements, and maintains automated fiat conversions and payouts. This makes it ideal for businesses—especially blue-chip and enterprise-level—that require solid legal and financial backstops.

Their long-term vision is to see global businesses and platforms integrate Bitcoin payments as seamlessly as credit cards—secure, censorship-resistant, and frictionless—while pushing forward broader adoption of Bitcoin as a unit of exchange across borders and cultures.
recovery_method: 2FA-protected dashboard with support-verified resets for account admins.

howto.title: Set up your OpenNode payment stack

steps.title: 1. Create and verify your account
actions: Register on the dev or production dashboard and pick individual or business onboarding.
Upload the requested ID, selfie, and proof-of-address documents so compliance can unlock payouts.
Enable two-factor authentication before inviting teammates or generating live API keys.
steps.gotcha: Higher processing limits stay capped until KYB completes, so have incorporation and ownership docs ready.

steps.title: 2. Configure charges and hosted checkout
actions: Create a test charge to see the hosted checkout render both the Lightning invoice and on-chain address.
Redirect shoppers to checkout.opennode.com/{id} and append ?ln=1 or ?hf=1 to default Lightning or hide fiat values.
Choose how each charge settles (BTC, fiat, split) inside Settings → Payments.
steps.gotcha: Lightning invoices above 500000000 sats will not generate, so split very large orders or route them on-chain.

steps.title: 3. Wire your webhooks and callbacks
actions: Pass a callback_url when creating charges so status changes post back to your app.
Subscribe to withdrawal webhooks because Lightning payouts can outlive a normal HTTP request cycle.
Test underpaid, paid, and refunded flows to confirm your order system reacts correctly.
steps.gotcha: Expose a public endpoint (or tunnel) for dev environments so OpenNode can reach your webhook URL.

steps.title: 4. Fund the fiat wallet and send payouts
actions: Contact support or use the live chat to wire fiat into your local currency wallet for payouts.
POST to /v2/withdrawals with auto_confirm set to false to preview the BTC quote before committing.
Confirm Lightning or on-chain payouts and monitor their status from the dashboard or webhook logs.
steps.gotcha: Preview quotes expire quickly, so confirm before the expiry timestamp if you want the same FX rate.

name: Peach

faqs.q: How does Peach multisig escrow protect peer-to-peer trades?
faqs.a: Each Peach trade starts with the seller locking sats in a 2-of-2 address that needs both the seller and Peach to co-sign the release. That prevents either party from moving the funds alone and lets Peach finish the release after roughly 4,320 blocks if a dispute stalls. You can copy the escrow address from the trade details and verify it on a block explorer before you send fiat.

faqs.q: Does Peach require KYC verification for every trade?
faqs.a: Peach operates under Swiss rules that allow KYC-free swaps up to about 1,000 CHF per person each day. That keeps small trades private while still meeting compliance. You can split larger purchases across days if you want to stay under the no-KYC threshold.

faqs.q: How do I back up my Peach account file safely?
faqs.a: Peach keeps your wallet, contacts, and payment templates in an encrypted account file that lives on your phone. If you lose that file or forget the password, Peach cannot restore the wallet for you. You can export the backup from Settings > Backup and store it offline on an SD card, computer, or encrypted cloud folder.

faqs.q: Which payment methods can I use on Peach?
faqs.a: Offers cover more than 100 rails ranging from SEPA, bank transfers, and Wise to gift cards and cash in person depending on your counterparty. That flexibility lets you meet peers where you already have accounts. You can filter offers by payment type so you only see options you trust.

faqs.q: What happens if my counterparty disappears during a trade?
faqs.a: If the other party stops responding, you can open a dispute inside the trade chat so Peach mediators review the evidence. They can co-sign the escrow to release bitcoin to the buyer or seller once payment proof is clear, preventing funds from getting stuck. You can keep screenshots, receipts, and chat logs ready so disputes resolve quickly.

recovery_method: Encrypted account file and seed stored on your device; restore from backup file with your password

WW.text: Required to build reputation on closed platform

description:
Peach Bitcoin is a mobile-only peer-to-peer platform for buying and selling Bitcoin. It stands out with its non-custodial model, using multi-signature escrow to secure trades without holding user funds, shifting trust to individual traders, and offering KYC-free (Know Your Customer) transactions up to 1,000 CHF daily, emphasizing privacy.

Users must build trust through reviews and completed trades to unlock higher transaction limits. It supports over 100 payment methods, including cash and gift cards, with a 2% fee for buyers and free selling.

Peach's mission is to make peer-to-peer Bitcoin trading the standard, promoting financial freedom, with plans to enhance Lightning Network support and expand globally, especially in Latin America and Africa. The vision is to offer a private, on‑the‑go way to trade Bitcoin without heavy identity requirements, making it attractive to beginners who want control and privacy without overcomplicating the process. Beginners love its privacy and ease, but some find the mobile-only platform limiting.

tl_dr.best_for: Buyers who want a mobile, non-custodial peer marketplace with escrow and no routine KYC.
tl_dr.consider_if: You already manage wallet backups and feel comfortable coordinating fiat payments directly with peers.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You expect a desktop interface, automated recurring buys, or an intermediary that holds funds for you.

steps.title: 1. Install and create your account
actions: Download Peach from the official App Store (Testflight), Google Play, or the APK page.
Set a strong password when the app creates your account file.

steps.gotcha: Peach cannot reset your password, so store it offline before you trade.

steps.title: 2. Back up your Peach account file
actions: Open Settings > Backup and export your encrypted account file.
Copy the file to two storage locations you control, such as an SD card and a laptop.
Store the backup password separately from the file so a thief cannot unlock both.
steps.gotcha: Losing both the file and password means Peach cannot recover your sats.

steps.title: 3. Complete a small test trade
steps.why: Practice the escrow flow before you scale up.
actions: Filter offers by country, currency, and the payment method you already trust.
Wait for the seller to fund escrow and confirm the transaction hash before paying.
Send a small amount of fiat, share proof in chat, and verify the bitcoin release in your wallet.
steps.gotcha: Keep chat inside the app so mediators can review the history if something goes wrong.

micro_faqs.q: How long do Peach trades usually take?
micro_faqs.a: Most trades settle within the payment window set by the seller; instant rails close in minutes while bank transfers can take a business day or two.

micro_faqs.q: Can I restore Peach after losing my phone?
micro_faqs.a: Yes. Install the app on a new device, import your backup file, and enter its password. Without the backup Peach cannot help.

micro_faqs.q: Does Peach have a desktop app?
micro_faqs.a: Not yet. Peach is mobile-only today, so you need the iOS, Android, or APK build to post offers.

description:
Phoenix is designed to provide a simple, self-custodial experience for fast, low-cost Lightning transactions directly on mobile devices, emphasizing ease of use for beginners.

Phoenix runs a native Lightning node on the user's device, connecting to ACINQ's node for automated channel management, eliminating the need for swaps and reducing fees for direct Lightning payments. Additionally, Phoenix allows connections to a user's own Bitcoin node for enhanced privacy.

For beginners, Phoenix's intuitive UI, low-cost Lightning transactions, and self-custodial design make it ideal for those starting with Bitcoin, though channel size limitations may require occasional fee adjustments for frequent receivers. Compared to Breez's merchant-centric features or Aqua's Liquid-focused versatility, Phoenix excels in delivering a straightforward, cost-effective Lightning experience with robust privacy options.

tl_dr.best_for: Mobile-first Lightning payments with self-custody and automated channel care.
tl_dr.consider_if: You expect to receive euro Lightning tips without running your own node.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You need desktop access or stronger payment privacy.

faqs.q: How does Pocket deliver bitcoin to my wallet?
faqs.a: Pocket executes your buy on Kraken and broadcasts the payout straight to the address you confirmed, using the lowest mining fee it can attach. You can watch the transaction land in your wallet without waiting for a withdrawal queue.

faqs.a: Pocket batches many customer payouts into one transaction so each order only pays a share of the mining fee, which usually lands around 500–1000 sats. You can reuse the same address for multiple transfers in a day when you want those payouts to share a fee.

faqs.a: Pocket routes every buy through Kraken at the live market price and passes that rate to you without a hidden spread. You can match their timestamp against Kraken's public order book for verification.

faqs.q: Can I schedule recurring buys that settle to my wallet?

Pocket Bitcoin stands out with its non-custodial model, sending Bitcoin directly to your wallet without holding funds, and a no-account, KYC-light approach for daily buys up to €1,000 | 0.01 BTC | 0.01 BTC, prioritizing privacy. Pocket's mission is to make Bitcoin ownership frictionless and private, promoting self-custody without complexity and with a vision to expand to a dozen more European countries and enhance wallet integrations.

Relai, founded in 2020 in Zürich, Switzerland, is an app designed for beginners to buy and save Bitcoin easily. Its app, rated 4.5 stars on iOS, is praised by users for simple onboarding and smooth navigation, though some users report verification delays or high card fees. Relai focuses on privacy and self-custody, with optional KYC for small transactions.

Its vision is to make Bitcoin saving accessible across Europe, with plans to add Lightning Network support for faster payments. Beginners love its straightforward design and security, but it's limited to Europe and lacks advanced savings features.
